data.name: Computer Science Club
data.description: The Computer Science Club exists to promote knowledge of and interest in computer science and to provide a place where those interested in computer science can connect. The club maintains an office where members gather, offers a library of computer science books, provides computer accounts on various machines, and frequently hosts computing-related events such as talks, tutorials, and demonstrations.

data.name: Double Degree Club
data.description: The Double Degree Club (DDC) is an official student-run organization registered at both the University of Waterloo and Wilfrid Laurier University. It aims to enhance the experience of Double Degree students by hosting social events, networking and mentorship opportunities, and providing academic resources. The club also collaborates with administration at both universities to support members’ social and professional development.

data.name: Statistics Club
data.description: The University of Waterloo’s Statistics Club is the official student-run club serving undergraduate statistics students. It is dedicated to uniting the statistics community on campus by offering a friendly and welcoming environment and providing resources that support the academic pursuit of statistics.

data.name: Actuarial Sciences Club
data.description: The UW Actuarial Sciences Club is the official student organization for actuarial science undergraduates. It brings together students interested in actuarial careers to network, learn, and improve their UW experience. The club hosts weekly social and informative events, lends actuarial exam study manuals, operates a mentorship program, and serves as a hub for actuarial-related news and events.

data.name: Financial Analysis or Risk Management Student Association
data.description: FARMSA is a non-profit student club open to all math students, including those not in the Math/FARM program. Its goals are to encourage academic pursuits related to Math/FARM, provide academic and professional services, improve cohesion among Math/FARM students, and promote the reputation and quality of the Math/FARM program.

data.name: Pure Math, Applied Math and Combinatorics & Optimization Club
data.description: The Pure Math, Applied Math and Combinatorics & Optimization Club is a non-profit student club open to anyone interested in various areas of mathematics. It organizes academic and social events such as talks by professors and students, math contests, and social gatherings. The club’s office (MC 3033) offers workspace, reference books, a blackboard/whiteboard, and computer access.

data.name: Data Science Club
data.description: The Data Science Club’s mission is to help the University of Waterloo produce top data scientists. It provides a platform for discussing data science topics and events and creates a supportive network for learning and job searches.

data.name: MathSoc Cartoons
data.description: MathSoc Cartoons is a student-run comic series that explains undergraduate math and computer science concepts. All comics can be found online as well as on the project’s Instagram and Facebook pages.

data.name: Math Ambassadors
data.description: Math Ambassadors is a volunteer program where students share their pride, experience, and knowledge to promote the Faculty of Mathematics. Volunteers engage with prospective students and parents, expand their campus knowledge, and develop leadership skills.

data.name: Mathematics Endowment Fund
data.description: The Mathematics Endowment Fund (MEF) is an income-generating fund that finances projects benefiting undergraduate math students at the University of Waterloo.

data.name: Math Orientation
data.description: Math Orientation helps incoming students find a supportive community to succeed both academically and socially. It fosters Faculty and school pride and encourages students to feel like Waterloo Warriors.

data.name: mathNEWS
data.description: mathNEWS is Waterloo’s bastion of erudite thought, providing a student-driven publication platform for commentary, articles, and insights.

data.name: Women in Math
data.description: Women in Math (WiM) is a committee dedicated to encouraging and advocating for women interested in studying mathematics and pursuing mathematical careers. It addresses cultural and institutional reasons for under-representation and strives for gender diversity within mathematics.

data.name: Women in Computer Science
data.description: Women in Computer Science (WiCS) is dedicated to promoting women who are interested in studying computer science and seeking careers in computing.

data.name: Mathematics Graduation Committee
data.description: The UW Mathematics Graduation Committee organizes events for graduating mathematics students, such as the Grad Ball and production of the yearbook.

data.name: Waterloo Engineering Endowment Fund
data.description: Founded in 1990 by engineering students Avi Belinsky and John Vellinga, the Waterloo Engineering Endowment Fund (WEEF) continuously improves the educational environment for undergraduate engineering students. Donations are invested and only the interest is spent each year on laboratory equipment, student projects, computer upgrades, and other academic resources, ensuring the principal grows as “The Gift That Keeps On Giving.”

data.name: The Iron Warrior
data.description: The Iron Warrior (IW) is the official newspaper of the Waterloo Engineering Society. Operated and produced by Society members, it serves as a forum for thought-provoking and informative articles and opinions from the Society, the Faculty of Engineering, and the wider University of Waterloo academic community.

data.name: UWaterloo EngiQueers
data.description: UWaterloo EngiQueers is a drop-in, anonymous chapter of the not-for-profit EngiQueers Canada. The group connects LGBTQ+ engineering students, offering a welcoming space through weekly informal meetings featuring queer-themed movies, discussions, and board games.

data.name: Women In Engineering
data.description: Women In Engineering (WiE), active at the University of Waterloo since 1992, aims to create an inclusive and intersectional community for engineering students of all genders. WiE supports and encourages current and future students—especially women, including trans and non-binary students—to pursue engineering careers by hosting social events and other initiatives each term.

data.name: National Society of Black Engineers
data.description: NSBE UW is the University of Waterloo collegiate chapter of the National Society of Black Engineers. It fosters an active community that supports the academic and professional success of Black engineering students through speaker series, Black Study Hall, mentorship programs, and other initiatives aimed at strengthening networks and improving the university experience.

data.name: American Indian Science and Engineering Society
data.description: AISES in Canada is dedicated to supporting and building community for Indigenous, Métis, and Inuit students in STEM. The UWaterloo chapter welcomes STEM students to connect with Indigenous peers, grow academically and professionally, and—for Fall 2023—launch a rocketry team to compete in the First Nations Launch competition.

data.name: Engineering Student Societies' Council of Ontario
data.description: The Engineering Student Societies’ Council of Ontario (ESSCO) represents engineering societies from 16 Ontario universities, acting as the link between engineering students, professional associations, academia, and government. Since 1987, ESSCO has promoted unity, continuity, and visibility among Ontario engineering students.

data.name: Canadian Federation of Engineering Students
data.description: The Canadian Federation of Engineering Students (CFES) is a national, bilingual organization representing approximately 81,000 engineering students across Canada. CFES provides opportunities that support comprehensive education and advocates for students at national and international levels to enhance the quality and scope of Canadian engineering education.
